paper_title.ja: Effects of Complex Organic Extracts on Plantlet Regeneration from PLBs and Plantlet Growth in the Doretaenopsis Orchid
ドリテノプシスの生育とイオン吸収量に及ぼす培養液のイオン組成の影響
paper_title.en: Effects of ionic composition and absorption from nutrient solutions on the growth of Doritaenopsis

description.ja: ミズゴケでドリテノプシスを栽培した場合の生育とイオン吸収に及ぼす培養液のイオン組成の影響について系統変量法を用いて検討した.葉中のクロロフィル含量は培養液中のイオン組成の影響を受けNO^-_3濃度の高い処理区で高くなった.生体重は培養液のイオン組成の影響を受け,K^+の増加は茎葉部の生長を促進し,Ca^<2+>の増加は茎葉の生長を阻害した.陰イオン組成は生体重に大きな影響を与えなかった.花序の生育も培養池のイオン組成によって異なった.陽イオン中のNH^+_4の増加によって満開日は早まった.陰イオンでは,SO^<2->_4の増加は花序重を減少させた.ドリテノプシスのミズゴケ栽培における施肥組成の好適範囲は培養液濃度をΣM^<n±>=8.5meq・liter^<-1>とした場合,NH^+_4 16.6%～21.8%. K^+ 38.3%～45.6%, Ca^<2+> 19.2%～24.9%, Mg^<2+> 17.0%, NO^-_3 64.8%～70.9%, H_2PO_4 10.7～13.7%, SO^<2->_4 17.8%～22.3%となった.
description.en: The effects of different nutrient solutions on growth and ionic absorption of Doritaenopsis plants grown in sphagnum moss were investigated by using systematically arranged ionic treatments. Chlorophyll content was the highest in the nutrient treatment containing the highest NO^-_3 concentration. Fresh weight of the plant was affected by the ionic composition of each nutrient solution; in high cationic treatments, shoot growth was promoted by K^+ but inhibited by Ca^<2+>. In anionic treatments, no significant effect on shoot growth occurred. Growth of root and inflorescence changed with ionic composition of a nutrient solution, such that an increase of NH^+_4 advanced the date of full blooming, whereas an increase in SO^<2->_4 decreased the weight of the inflorescence. The optimal ranges of ions are NH^+_4, 16.6%-21.8%; K^+, 38.3%-45.6%; Ca^<2+>, 19.2%-24.9%; Mg^<2+>, 17.0%; NO^-_3, 64.8%-70.9%; H_2PO_4, 10.7-13.7%; SO^<2->_4, 17.8%-22.3% when Σ M^<n±>=8.5 meq・liter^<-1>.

paper_title.ja: 植込み材料からのイオン放出と培養液からのイオン吸収並びにドリテノプシスの生育について(共著)
paper_title.en: Ion Release from Potting Materials, the Absorption of Ions from Nutrient Solution and Growth of Doritaenopsis

description.ja: 植え込み材料の違いによるドリテノプシスの生育や養分吸収を検討するため, 各種植え込み材料のイオン放出特性, ならびにそれらに植えた苗を定期的に培養液に浸漬し, その生育と培養液からの各イオン量の減少を調査した.1. 殺菌した処理区と対照区での植え込み材料のイオン放出特性はそれぞれ異なった.ミズゴケやヤシ殻チップからは多量要素イオンの放出が比較的多く認められた.栽培後の植え込み材料では, これらのイオンの放出は著しく低下した.2. 各植え込み材料での植物の生育はミズゴケで良好であった.しかし他区での生育は劣った.この違いには, 培地の通気性と保水性の他, イオン放出量も関係すると考えられた.3. 各植え込み材料での培養液からのイオン吸収量は異なり.生育良好なミズゴケ区での吸収量は多かった.その原因の一部は, 植え込み材料からのイオン放出の違いにあると考えられた.
description.en: The release of major ions into deionized distilled water from fresh and used New Zealand sphagnum moss, Chinese sphagnum moss, New Zealand bark, coconut husk chips, and rock wool under aseptic and non-aseptic conditions were investigated to clarify the aspects of ion release. Absorption of major ions from a nutrient solution by potted Doritaenopsis plants with comparable materials and their growth was also studied. 1. Release of ions from 5 different potting materials differed both in aseptic and non-aseptic conditions. Major elements ions released from sphagnum moss and coconut husk chips were much more than those from the other potting materials. Release of ions from used materials was significantly less. 2. Doritaenopsis potted with sphagnum moss grew better than did those with New Zealand bark, coconut husk chips or rock wool ; growth differences among the 5 different potting materials seemed to be caused by their different water holding capacity and/or major ion release. 3. The ability to absorb major ions differed among potting materials. Doritaenopsis potted with sphagnum moss absorbed more major ions. The difference is attributed partially to the ions, which are released from the potting materials.

paper_title.ja: Effects of Sucaose, Maltose and Sorbitol on Callus Growth and Plantlet Regenelation in Phalaenopsis, Doritaenopsis, and Neofinetia.(共著)
paper_title.en: Effects of Sucrose, Maltose and Sorbitol on Callus Growth and Plantlet Regeneration in Phalaenopsis, Doritaenopsis and Neofinetia

ja.name: イスラム オバイドル M

description.ja: スクロース, マルトース, ソルビトールがファレノプシス, ドリテノプシス, フウランのカルスの生育と幼植物分化に及ぼす, 炭素源としての効果について調べた.供試したカルスは黄色のフライアブルなもので, スクロースを添加した培地では, 供試時と同様な性状で良好に増殖した.マルトースあるいはソルビトールを添加した培地では, 供試カルスの多くはPLBを形成し, 続いて幼植物を分化した.また分化した幼植物の外観は正常で健全であった.一部のファレノプシスのカルスとフウランのカルスは緑色の細胞塊を形成したが, PLBならびに幼植物は分化しなかった.
description.en: The effects of sucrose, maltose, and sorbitol on callus growth of Phalaenopsis, Doritaenopsis, and Neofinetia were investigated. Calli derived from these three genera, grown on sucrose medium enriched with coconut endosperm, grew rapidly but remained friable and yellowish even after 3 subcultures at 8-week intervals. Calli of most cultivars, grown on maltose or sorbitol medium, initiated protocorm-like bodies (PLBs) which subsequently developed into plantlets. Regenerated plantlets were normal and healthy in appearance. Calli of a few Phalaenopsis and Neofinetia proliferated into green masses and continued to grow but did not develop either PLBs or plantlets.

publisher.en: THE JAPANESE SOCIETY FOR HORTICULTURAL SCIENCE

publication_name.ja: Journal of the Japanese Society for Horticultural Science
publication_name.en: Journal of the Japanese Society for Horticultural Science

paper_title.ja: Effects of Complex Organic Additives on Callus Growth in Three Orchid Genera, Phalaenopsis, Doritaenopsis, and Neofinetia. 共著
paper_title.en: Effects of Complex Organic Additives on Callus Growth in Three Orchid Genera, Phalaenopsis, Doritaenopsis, and Neofinetia

ja.name: イスラム モハマド オバイドゥル

description.ja: ファレノプシス, ドリテノプシス, フウランのカルスの生育は培地量の影響を受け, 培地量が5 mlの場合は培養8週間で生育の低下が, 10 mlでは10週間で生育の低下が見られたが, 20 mlの場合は12週間後まで生育が持続した.サトイモ抽出物(TE), ジャガイモ抽出物(PE), ココナッツウオーター(CW), リンゴ抽出物(APE)の培地への添加は, カルスの生育を促進したがその効果は濃度によって異なった.TEの添加効果は, 幅広い濃度範囲(50-200 ml・1^<-1>)で大きかった.バナナ磨砕物(BH), ペプトン添加の効果はあまり認められなかった.サツマイモ抽出物(SPE)は, 試験した濃度範囲ではカルスの生育に阻害的であった.TE, PE, CWの効果は, 供試品種によって異なった.CW, TE, PE, APEの組み合わせ添加効果は認められず, TEの単独添加が最も効果があった.
description.en: Growth rates of Phalaenopsis callus differed depending on the volume of media. Whereas callus growth on 5-ml of medium slowed after 8 weeks of culture, that on 10- and 20-ml of media grew slower after 10 and 12 weeks, respectively. Taro extract (TE), potato extract (PE), coconut water (CW), and apple extract (APE) enhanced callus growth but the effects depended on the quantity of each supplement. TE was the best additive tested on callus growth when 50 to 200 ml・1^<-1> were added. Banana homogenate (BH) and peptone had little effect on callus growth, whereas sweet potato extract (SPE) proved inhibitory at all levels tested. The effects of TE, PE, and CW depended on each callus. No synergistic effects of CW, TE, PE, and APE were observed.
